questions.question: Which of the conditions given below is most likely to lead to the formation of radiation fog?
options: a. Wind speed 7 kt Cloud Cover $8/8$ St Temperature $12^{\circ}C$ Dew Point $11^{\circ}C$
b. Wind speed 15 kt Cloud Cover NIL Temperature $15^{\circ}C$ Dew Point $14^{\circ}C$
c. Wind speed 3 kt Cloud Cover $1/8$ Ci Temperature $8^{\circ}C$ Dew Point $7^{\circ}C$
d. Wind speed 12 kt Cloud Cover NIL Temperature $-2^{\circ}C$ Dew Point $-3^{\circ}C$

questions.question: When ______ moist air passes over a surface which is ______ than the dew point of the air, ______ fog can form. This occurs over ______. Examine the statement above; the line which contains the correct words in the correct order to complete the statement is:
options: a. cool warmer radiation the sea
b. warm cooler radiation the land only
c. cool warmer frontal land
d. warm cooler advection land and sea

questions.question: Radiation fog is most likely at an inland airfield in the UK with a relative humidity of 80% in the ______ with ______ and a wind of ______.
options: a. autumn clear skies 2-8 knots
b. spring $6/8$ ST& SC 2-10 knots
c. winter clear skies 15/20 knots
d. summer clear skies no wind

questions.question: Advection fog is formed when ______ air moves over a ______ surface and is ______ its dew point:
options: a. humid cold kept above
b. warm moist cooler cooled below
c. dry frozen well below
d. warm moist warmer kept above

questions.question: On a night when radiation fog is forming over most of southern England, the aerodromes likely to be first to experience the fog will be those situated:
options: a. near the coast with a light onshore wind and clear skies
b. near the coast with a land breeze and cloudy skies
c. at the bottom of the hill with a light katabatic wind blowing
d. at the top of a hill with clear skies and no wind

questions.question: Radiation fog is most likely:
options: a. with a wind speed up to 15 kt, a clear sky and a high relative humidity
b. with a wind of 2-8 kt, a high density and the summer season
c. in an anticyclone in winter
d. on a hill in autumn

questions.question: If a station equipped with IRVR equipment reports RVR 1000, this means:
options: a. RVR at touchdown is 1000 metres
b. RVR at touchdown is 1000 metres and at 'mid point' and 'stop end' the RVR is 800 metres or more
c. RVR at touchdown is 1000 metres and 'mid point' and 'stop end' equipment is unserviceable
d. RVR all along the runway is 1000 metres or more

questions.question: Changes of RVR are reported for increments of:
options: a. 25 m up to 250 m
b. 25 m up to 200 m
c. 50 m between 300 m and 800 m
d. 50 m between 500 m and 800 m

questions.question: Frontal fog is most likely to:
options: a. form ahead of a vigorous fast moving cold front
b. form ahead of a warm front
c. form on a vigorous cold front and last for many hours
d. form to the rear of a warm front but only last for 1 to 2 hours

questions.question: Fog may be defined as:
options: a. a reduction of visibility to less than 1000 metres due to the presence of water vapour in the atmosphere
b. a reduction of visibility to less than 1000 metres due to the presence of water droplets in suspension in the atmosphere
c. a reduction of visibility to less than 1500 metres due to the presence of water droplets in suspension in the atmosphere
d. a reduction of visibility to less than 1000 ft due to the presence of water vapour in suspension in the atmosphere

questions.question: Several types of pressure distribution may be associated with radiation fog but all have one feature in common which is:
options: a. closely spaced isobars
b. a tight pressure gradient
c. a slack pressure gradient
d. a rapidly falling pressure

questions.question: ______ forms when moist air ______ over a surface which is ______ than the dew point of the air. Fill in the missing words from the list given below:
options: a. Radiation fog, passes, warmer
b. Advection fog, settles, cooler
c. Advection fog, passes, cooler
d. Radiation fog, settles, warmer

questions.question: Advection fog:
options: a. only occurs at night and early morning
b. is most likely with Polar Maritime air
c. will only clear by insolation
d. can sometimes last for 24 hours or more in winter

questions.question: In circumstances where there is a clear sky, calm wind and a high relative humidity in autumn:
options: a. radiation fog is likely over night
b. advection fog will form
c. radiation fog is likely at sunrise after previous mist
d. hill fog can be expected

questions.question: At a station equipped with IRVR, reports are given:
options: a. every 1/2 hour
b. when the normal visibility is 1500 m or less
c. when there is mist
d. when there is haze
